author: Cortex XSOAR

automation.description: This script gets the email address of the incident owner and then returns the incident owner username in Bonusly.
automation.name: IncOwnerToBonuslyUser

commands.description: Gets a list of bonuses based on the supplied filters.
commands.name: bonusly-list-bonuses

commands.description: Gets a bonus by bonus ID.
commands.name: bonusly-get-bonus

commands.description: Deletes a bonus by bonus ID.
commands.name: bonusly-delete-bonus

integration.description: The Bonusly integration is used to interact with the Bonusly platform through the API. Bonusly is an employee recognition platform which enterprises use to for employee recognition.
integration.name: Bonusly (Community Contribution)

playbook.description: AutoGratitude is a playbook to give back a positive gratitude to security engineers and developers when they successfully complete an SLA
playbook.name: Bonusly - AutoGratitude

The platform which also has an API enables employees to recognize each other by providing a point based bonus system. name: Bonusly
readme:
## Overview

Bonus.ly is an employee recognition platform which enterprises use to for employee recognition. We're building tools to help people feel a sense of purpose and progress at work. The platform which also has an API enables employees to recognize each other by providing a point based bonus system. Bonus.ly helps your employees feel connected, engaged, and aligned is mission critical right now. Bonusly makes employee recognition easy and fun, fostering community and creating company-wide alignment. It also provides employees with positive feedback in the work that they are doing.

To utilize the example playbooks in this content package you will need a list in your XSOAR list settings similar to the following.

Create a Lookup JSON List In The Lists Section Containing XSOAR Email To Bonusly User

{
"shrek@paloaltonetworks.com":"@shrek", 
"donkey@paloaltonetworks.com":"@donkey"
}
